cyclone.name: HARVEY
cyclone.current_location: about 250 miles SE of Corpus Christi, Texas
cyclone.trajectory: moving northwest toward the middle Texas coast, then forecast to slow and meander near/just inland for several days
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: middle Texas coast near Port O'Connor–Corpus Christi

weather_observation.under_warning: Tropical Storm Warning and Storm Surge Warning
weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical-storm warning north of Sargent to High Island, and storm-surge warning Port Mansfield to High Island (includes Texas City/Galveston Bay)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: entire middle and upper Texas coast from Port Mansfield through High Island including Galveston Bay
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (39–57 mph) are likely; brief hurricane-force gusts cannot be ruled out if Harvey tracks a little farther north.
weather_observation.storm_surge: 2–4 ft of surge possible for Jamaica Beach to High Island, including Texas City and Galveston Bay waterfront facilities.
weather_observation.rainfall: 15–25 inches of rain with locally higher totals could lead to prolonged, life-threatening flooding that will disrupt port operations for days.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes and dangerous rip currents possible; long duration flooding may impede ground transport routes to and from the port.
